page.title: 03Amenities in Whitwell
page.content: The two provision shops in Whitwell, one of which incorporates a Post Office,serve the community,and there is a Methodist Church,a Village Hall and a Youth Hostel.Renovations and improvements have been carried out to several of these recently.The majority of the building along the High Street is of stone,or mellow brick.Gardens are well maintained in general throughout the village,and there are green areas.An unusual feature of the village is a series of water pumps, installed by a local benefactor in the past. A hope was expressed in a recent community survey that no further development should take place,to avoid urbanising the village, and some considered too much had already been allowed.
